main event: An observer reported sighting a disk-shaped object with an amber color in Dayton, Ohio, on March 24, 1963.
interesting points: The object was observed for a total duration of 25 minutes, including 15 minutes of continuous sighting, It was estimated to have a diameter of 50 feet, The object moved at a high rate of speed towards the East, The conclusion listed the object as possibly being a meteor or satellite, The sighting was categorized as a ground-visual observation.
witness description: details about the observer are not disclosed
